intro: Ornithogalum anatolicum, commonly known as Anatolian star-of-Bethleem, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or dry soils. It is part of the Asparagaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Ornithogalum anatolicum is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
